definition: to sauté/to stir-fry/to speculate/to hype/to fire (sb)

sentences.english: I heard that the anchorman of the DBD TV network's evening news got fired.
sentences.chinese: 我听说DBD电视网的晚间新闻主播被炒鱿鱼。

sentences.english: B：They will be fired some day.
sentences.chinese: 他们总有一天会被炒鱿鱼。

sentences.english: Hi, Maggy, Did you hear about David?
sentences.chinese: 我听说戴维被炒鱿鱼了。

sentences.english: After working in the office for ten years， Alice was fired for no apparent reason.
sentences.chinese: 爱丽斯工作了十年之后，无缘无故被炒鱿鱼。

sentences.english: And which of you goes home and rationalizes being fired as character building?
sentences.chinese: 谁会回家反省找出被炒鱿鱼的原因以重塑性格？

sentences.english: NO06,1. The scuttlebutt in the office is that Tom is going to be fired.
sentences.chinese: 办公室里有谣言说汤姆要被炒鱿鱼了。

sentences.english: I heard that BCB's evening news anchor was canned.
sentences.chinese: 电视网的晚间新闻主播被炒鱿鱼。

sentences.english: You did what you were told to do or you were fired.
sentences.chinese: 叫你做什么你就得去做，不然就被炒鱿鱼。

sentences.english: That bozo flirt with the boss'daughter and nearly get fired.
sentences.chinese: 那个笨蛋跟老板的女儿调情，差一点被炒鱿鱼。

sentences.english: Candidate told the interviewer he was fired for beating up his last boss.
sentences.chinese: 应聘者奉告面试官上次炒鱿鱼的端由是揍了那位雇主。

sentences.english: Which of you goes home and rationalizes being fired as character building?
sentences.chinese: 谁会回家反省找出被炒鱿鱼的原因以重塑性格？

definition: to fire/to sack/to dismiss/to terminate employment
to expel (a member of an organization)/to fire (an employee)
variant of 老闆|老板[lao3 ban3]
to get a better job somewhere else (idiom)/to seek alternative employment
to come off sentry duty/to lay off (a worker)/laid-off
to try to persuade sb to give up (their job, plans etc)
to pack and quit/to be sacked
